thread.title: No. 2 Kansas survives against No. 3 Baylor with 73-68 win
thread.title_full: No. 2 Kansas survives against No. 3 Baylor with 73-68 win

title: No. 2 Kansas survives against No. 3 Baylor with 73-68 win

organizations.name: usa today sports north carolina state

text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email No. 2 Kansas survives against No. 3 Baylor with 73-68 win Josh Jackson lead the Jayhawks to victory against the Bears Post to Facebook No. 2 Kansas survives against No. 3 Baylor with 73-68 win Josh Jackson lead the Jayhawks to victory against the Bears Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2jXY49Z Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs No. 2 Kansas survives against No. 3 Baylor with 73-68 win USA TODAY Sports 11:02 p.m. ET Feb. 1, 2017 Kansas guard Devonte’ Graham celebrates after making a three point shot against the Baylor Bears. (Photo: Jay Biggerstaff, USA TODAY Sports) 
No. 2 Kansas is still undefeated at home. 
The Jayhawks overcame a six-point halftime deficit to defend their home floor and defeat No. 3 Baylor 73-68 Wednesday night. 
Kansas has now won 51 consecutive games at Allen Fieldhouse. 
Josh Jackson lead the way for Kansas with 23 points and 11 rebounds. 
Jonathan Motley had 16 points and 10 rebounds. 
Kansas improved to 20-2 on the season while Baylor dropped to 20-2. Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed.
